instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board fan spin all rail there , no external disply or turn on
threads.message:
got this mac air with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board , fan spin , all power rail is there, cpu voltage is there, it might have slight liquid damage, copper round pad are slight discolour,  all rail have power, <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> there, 

only missing power rail is l3095,  and L7701,     cpu turn hot, , <SIGNAL>ALL_PWR</SIGNAL> is good,   any idea what is wrong ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board fan spin all rail there , no external disply or turn on
threads.message:
Try new BIOS first.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BUF_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> both present?
Do you get USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board fan spin all rail there , no external disply or turn on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 50965"]Try new BIOS first.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BUF_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> both present?
Do you get USB activity?[/QUOTE]

both present, , when i connect or turn on board usb blink once , bios is <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> right ?  i tried with a 3437 board bios no luck,  


also i notice, Y1915           <SIGNAL>PCH_CLK24M_XTALIN</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>CH_CLK24M_XTALOUT</SIGNAL> ohave .374v ... are those Volt correct?
